column4: there're utilities to check your mail, and even an evolution plugin to notify you (i think)
and you might look for something under "evolution" and maybe under "thunderbird"
fetchmail will get your mail, but won't notify you
you could use, say, GNU messages from GNU Mailutils to check your mail and write a script to notify you. or you could, again, check for an evolution or firefox plugin :-)
look at the dependencies for kubuntu-desktop
and uninstall any of them whose removal doesn't conflict with having ubuntu-desktop
ratpoison, gnu screen, emacs, & conkeror are tied :-)
actually, i just kind of make things up and they often work :-)
that's basically how i do most things...guess, ask questions, and tinker until i like it
what happens if you hit ctrl+alt+F!
